Reviews.Title: “Marvellous Stay”
Reviews.Author: faithfullwishing
Reviews.Content: Silken St. Gervasi Hotel was a great discovery. Me and my fiancee stayed in this hotel in October for 3 nights and we had wonderful stay. The staff were friendly, rooms were bright and spacious. The cleaning were done regularly and towels were changed everyday. The location is good because it's 2-3mins away from the El putxet station. The neighbourhood is quiet and away from the chaos and traffic of the city centre. I will definitely reccomend this and I will surely go back to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: natycyp
Reviews.Content: Immaculate little hotel!! Simple, nice and very clean, furniture was new, no scratches or stains, soft comfortable beds. Traveller's kit a pleasant bonus. Extremely helpful staff, bless them. Living in a touristic place, I could say this 3* could even rival some of our 4 & 5 stars in terms of being neat and clean. No balcony and the view to the back yard was quite shabby but who cares when you run around sightseeing all day and just switch off on your soft bed after a nice hot bath.

Reviews.Title: “Just the job”
Reviews.Author: Stephen C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with modern, clean rooms and excellent service. The value for money was frankly unbelievable, and the location is excellent for the city centre, airport and all the sights we wanted to see. If I ever return to Barcelona, it will definitely be to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Nick_Sal_34A
Reviews.Content: If there was a rating between 'average' & 'good' I would have used it. 'Very good' is slightly generous. The hotel is modern, clean and comfortable but not outstanding in my opinion. There were too many little niggles which spoilt it for us. For example the wifi is virtually non-existent on the higher floors and we needed to get new codes every day to get access which became frustrating. Our door keys kept resetting themselves which meant several tips back down to reception to sort out (ok, maybe just bad luck). The thing I would definitely warn about is the car park. I consider myself a reasonably good driver and we had rented quite a small car but I found it very difficult to manoeuvre around the narrow underground car park and resorted to actually trying to reverse in as it was so difficult to get out of the small spaces. The location is good with a metro stop only a minute's walk away and we found it quite easy to get out of the city from there as it is located near one of the main roads. All in all I would say good but not outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lissam151
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in December. The hotel was very close to a metro stop, clean, full size bathtub/shower which is a treat in Europe. The neighborhood was cute with a few good pastry shops. I would stay stay here again if I head back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good price but a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: beaker121974
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated a matter of minutes away from Las Rambla and the central hub in a nice quiet area From our experience don't accept a room on the ground floor - room was humid and i was awoken by the smell of bacon which some may like but i don't eat or like !. Upon asking the reception what the issue was with the room temp and bacon smell - i was informed the aircon is turned off and the i was lying about the smell in room, in fact the peron was down right rude. My request was simple can i change room !. Good price and away from the all the noise - so you would think the windows are made from paper. Overall good price and location staff could improve somewhat

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: costinescu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located only 15 minutes from Placa Catalunya, 5 metro stops. It is located in a quiet neighbourhood, 2 minutes walk from the metro station (El Putxet on L7). We stayed there for 7 nights and it was one of the most beautiful hotels we have ever been to. Very helpful staff, free wifi and great breakfast. The hotel is increadible clean, my thanks and my regards to the staff who make this possible. We got a room on the ground floor with a nice terrace and it was the perfect way of spending the evenings after a busy day of walking around Barcelona. For sure we will come back to this hotel next time we will arrive in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “good find”
Reviews.Author: Mars1771
Reviews.Content: I actually really enjoyed staying here. at first i thought it would be out of the way but with the underground met L7 (El Putxet) it was about 7 stops to the centre. walking is good as well but the hills! Great way to shed off the amazing food. Staff were so helpful while I was here, and free wifi (my friends stayed in a very expensive hotel and had to pay for theres) i did not get breakfast at the hotel so can not comment as i wanted to enjoy the pastry shops YUM! they are all over the place

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money if Wifi is not needed.”
Reviews.Author: mknittel
Reviews.Content: Based on having paid only around $90 I consider this hotel an excellent value. Located 15 minutes from the center by metro (L7) within a minute's walk of the station on a side street, and within walking distance to Park Guell (25 minutes). The room had comfortable beds and was very clean, if somewhat small, and the room service met our needs right away (extra pillows). The staff at the reception was helpful but not exactly friendly. Sergio, the young man who works in the afternoon does not seem motivated to do his job. The WiFi connection is a pain in the neck. We were not able to use our ipods from the room and had to use Skype in the reception area, even after switching rooms. There is a tiny supermarket across the hotel and a bakery around the corner. There is also an upscale tapas place next to the hotel and a more down to earth one across from the metro station. The walls are somewhat thin, especially on the ground floor. Sleep with ear plugs and you will not hear the staff at breakfast time.

Reviews.Title: “would not go back”
Reviews.Author: yauany
Reviews.Content: It's nothing wrong with this hotel, the location of this hotel is literrally 4 metro stops from the central barcelona, a lil bit too far but acceptable, but i would rather pay a bit more to stay in central barcelona, which could avoid you from the hassel of dragging your luggage on and off from the metro and stairs. Nice hotel but no coffeemaker in the room, room size is small. But there's not much going on around the hotel, becuz it's nice and quiet residential neighborhood. If you going back to hotel late by metro, you have to wait a bit longer for the L7 at night

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in calm area”
Reviews.Author: houari_id
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights there due to some business in nearby Sant Gervasi area. Although it is not located in the middle of the city, it is located very close to the El Putxet station which can brings you easily to the downtown Catalunya as well as to the nearby Tibidabo (just one station away where you can fetch the blue tourist bus). It is also within less than 30 minutes walk distance to the Park Guell.

Reviews.Title: “Great great great”
Reviews.Author: LuljaNYC
Reviews.Content: Really loved this hotel. It's what I'm used to from hotels in America and in the Caribbean. Very clean. Comfortable beds. Comfortable linens and pillows. Spacious and clean bathroom. Location was perfect. Out of city center but around the corner from the nearest Metro station. Staff was alright. One front desk man, however, was a bit snotty and we didn't get much help from him. Definitely recommend this place. I loved coming back after a long day of sight seeing or the beach and jumping into the comfy bed. Also, free wireless access.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but You could find better”
Reviews.Author: BartYao
Reviews.Content: The great things about this hotel are its location and price. Staying here would definitely be cheaper than staying at hotels in Las Ramblas or other tourist areas. It is just a block away from the El putxet FGC station, which takes you to plaza catalunya in about 10mins. The rooms are big enough and are clean and quiet. What i disliked were the internet service and the food. Their free wifi was totally unreliable. We did not get any signal from our room so i had to use my laptop at their reception area only. The food was terrible, probably microwave or ready to eat stuff so you better grab something to eat before you bet back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, acceptable hotel”
Reviews.Author: entzipfer
Reviews.Content: Generic business class hotel convenient to metro and the city center, located in a relatively quiet street. The rooms were clean, with free Wifi (which is restricted to web access, so forget using email or Fring), and there was free coffee on the hall. Like most things in this part of Barcelona the price seems out of line with what one gets. My main complaint is the atrocious directions we received from the hotel staff; we were sent 2 hours out of our way due to faulty directions, which we confirmed twice by phone with them, before we received corrected instructions.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in quiet area.”
Reviews.Author: Salfordred_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights at the end of April. Check in was extremely straightforward. The receptionist was so helpful and gave us lots of information about the local area. We had an inward facing room. You couldn't hear a thing from outside. Unfortunately the soundproofing between the bedrooms isn't as good but overall, it was very quiet for sleeping. The beds are two pushed together but they were roomy and spotless. The room was cleaned to a high standard every day. This hotel is not right in the centre of Barcelona, however it is only ten minutes on the train into the Ramblas. If you are travelling around anyway, then it's really no hardship. The T-10 card is exceptional value and so easy to use. The trains are frequent, clean and safe. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel but there are enough cafes and two supermarkets nearby to accomodate this. To get to the hotel, look at the posting from June 2008 from another contributor, giving very extensive directions (very helpful). If you get the train from Catalunya, look for the metro sign, outside Cafe Zurich, as the FCG train sign isn't as easy to spot. If you go to Camp Nou, be prepared to queue and pay £19 euro entry (we didn't want to queue so we missed it!). The Olympic stadium is free to get in, you can't walk all round it but you can go in and look for free. The Olympic museum is also well worth a visit. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mainly good but could be even better by resolving some irritating points”
Reviews.Author: Travelexperience12
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a travel agent and independently checked our reservation with the hotel. The confirmatory response was impressively fast. The hotel is situated away from the city centre, but very close to a metro station which enables travel to the centre in approximately 15 minutes, and also provides access to other parts of the city. The T10 multi journey ticket recommended at check-in is very good value, with each journey costing 82.5 cents On arrival in our room we found that a leak in the washbasin had been very poorly disguised, presumeably by the cleaning staff. However, we were very quickly allocated an alternative room. The rooms were quite satisfactory, apart from being extremely hot (25 degrees). In response to our request for the air conditioning to be examined we were advised that it was not activated until slightly later in the year. We resolved the problem by opening the window in the evening and closing it at night to avoid trafiic noise, which did not disturb sleep through the close window. We ate in the hotel restaurant on one night. The menu was limited, but the service and food was excellent. Unfortunately the menu did not change during our five day stay, which influenced us to subsequently eat elsewhere. Equally we did not take advantage of breakfast which we felt to be expensive at almost 13 Euros. Overall, the value was good, and our general experience satisfactory

Reviews.Title: “Great place just 15-20min away from the very centre of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: domyue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the end of Feb (which is a great time to go - not too many tourists!). We were on the second floor and the room size was reasonable. Small gripes with the double bed actually being 2 singles and with the single duvets tucked into each bed - so not too couple friendly there. Whilst we're at the negatives, another thing is that the air conditioning, we're told, is switched off for the autumn/winter months. It's completely inoperable until spring and we found our room very stuffy at first. Nothing that a slightly ajar window didn't fix. The streets are not too noisy at all and it's a very quiet residential area, so it was fine to sleep with a slightly open window. Apart from those small things, it was overall a very enjoyable stay. The location is brilliant - very safe and literally 1-2 minute walk to the station (El Puxtet on L7 underground line). If you come from the airport, the T10 ticket (similar to a carnet, it's a ticket with 10 journeys on it) works fine - you can get from the airport to the hotel in one journey (even if you change trains, the T10 only deducts once per passenger). Multiple passengers can use it (just need to feed it into the machine for each passenger to go through the gate) and costs just under 9 Euros. Incidentally, there are multiple companies that operate the underground system in Barcelona and if you swap between the companies (e.g. going from L3 to L7), then you need to use 2 separate single tickets. However, the T10 allows you to use the all the metro lines and interchange as much as you need without charging more than that one journey - so remarkable value really. If you need to return El Puxtet area from the city late at night after the trains have stopped, the N5 bus takes you from some of the main streets in the city (e.g. from Catalunya) straight up past Pl Molina, Padua and then there's a stop just before a cross-road (you'll have to look at the map/ask the driver) - and this stop is 3 minutes from the hotel. So, again, very accessible. Back to the hotel itself - there is also free wireless internet - good speeds in our rooms. There is a small supermarket near the El Puxtet station, which also has a few market stalls in that same building. If you need something small, directly opposite the hotel is a convenience store. Would recommend to friends and stay here again - 4.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: dalisoccer
Reviews.Content: Before traveling to Barcelona, I didnt know what to expect. I booked this hotel based on the reviews and it was a good choice. Hotel is located in the quite neighborhood. Very close to Park Güell (about 15 min walk) and 2 min away from the Metra Station. Their metra is so organized and easy to understand that I would deffinitely recommend to anyone that is going to Barcelona to use it. From the station it takes only 10 minutes to get to Placa de Catalnuya (downtown area of Barcelona). Staff very friendly and knowledgable about the area. I would recommend hotel to families as well, since its so close to the metra and at the same time very safe. The only thing is that rooms are very small, but that is normal standard for Hotels in Europe. A lot different compared to rooms in US.

Reviews.Title: “a few modifs could make this place tops”
Reviews.Author: FuninNormandy
Reviews.Content: For a three-star hotel this is excellent value for the money, clean, new and very close to the metro. Overall I certainly would stay again and would recommend A few minor details could make it even better (closer to a 4 star rating in my opinion); -Tissues in the rooms and/or bathrooms -At least one English newspaper available (the clientele seems very international and the only onsite newspapers are in Spanish/Catalan) and they are not so easy to find in the immediate area If you go; -Be sure to stay in the back our room was very quiet and comfortable (no noise at all) -Recommend taking the option of wifi and breakfast included in rates (overall you will save money) Again was pleasantly surprised and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience!”
Reviews.Author: YvonneRoma
Reviews.Content: The hotel St Gervasi is a very nice hotel with a good level in terms of quality/price. Breakfst price per person is a bit expensive that’s the reason why we preferred not include it and go to the close coffee shops that the area offers. After all for Italian people like us a cup of milk and coffee + pastry is really enough! Our room was large and very clean and the bathroom very spacious. The Staff was very helpful each time we need any sort of information and on the day out, If you take the Touristic Bus, the guide will tell you that this area (St Gervasi) is one of the most elegant of Barcelona where there is the greatest number of private schools and the most famous bakeries in town. The area of St Gervasi is much quiter than downtown and if you are looking for some typical restaurants or places where to have “tapas” , be aware that here the choice is very limited . Nevertheless, at the St Gervasi Silken Hotel you have the advantage to stay very close to the railways (FerroCarril L7 Station Putxet) that , in less than 10 minutes, leads you to the Placa de Calaluna from where at walking distance you can reach the Rambla or many other famous sites. Another good point in favour of the St Gervasi Silken Hotel is that it’s close to the beautiful Park Guell and to the Tibidabo mountain.

Reviews.Title: “thumbs up for St. Gervasi and its stuff: simply the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: Thessal0niki
Reviews.Content: We stayed in St. Gervasi hotel on August 5th and 6th (room 107) and on Aug 10th and 11th (room 510). Our impressions? The very best. Let me explain. This hotel is situated in the St. Gervasi region, which is 5 subway stations away (line 7, station ElPutext) from placa Catalunya, which is the centre of everything if you are a tourist in Barcelona. The hotel is not a walking distance from the major attractions, so people who do not want to use the subway for some reason might find it uncomfortable. For the rest, the ElPutxet station is 3mins away from the hotel and the subway is always a good way to get accustomed to a city. Originally we booked the hotel because it came with a good price and some good comments on trip advisor. We were so lucky. During our first stay, we got a smoking room (107) on the first floor: decent size, very clean,big bathroom, sound-proof although the housekeeping room was next door. During our second stay, there was no smoking room available, so we were upgraded(!) on the 5th floor (510): very spacious room, nice view of spanish terraces, huge bathroom and also very quiet. The overall appearence of the hotel is non-pretentious and cosy. The lobby is comfortable, although not too big or fancy. On ground level, breakfast is served. It costs 13Euros/person and includes pretty much all you can usually ask in a breakfast, plus some dishes on request with no extra cost. On the ground floor, a pc with internet access is also available (2Euros/30mins). WiFi access is also available. So far, so good. All in all, Silken St Gervasi would be a decent hotel for budget travellers, which we would simply recommend. However, the stuff of this hotel makes all the difference. You can get plenty of clean rooms and hot-served breakfasts in a lot of hotels but you cannot easily get access to such friendly, kind and intelligent young people that welcome you and make you feel at home. This hotel's stuff was simply amazing. Isabel and Marc work at the reception and give hospitality a whole new meaning. They both speak excellent English (Marc also speaks great Italian), they are fast, proactive and know how to serve you right. Our check-in was fast, our check-out equally good. When we arrived for the second time, Marc would remember our name, asked about the trip we had in France and apologized for the lack of a smoking room. Late at night, we asked for a blanket and Marc just got it for us in zero time. When we first checked-in, we didnt know how to use the air-condition, both Isabel and the housekeeping lady were eager to assist. MOreover, during the last night, when I was trying to e- check-in for our flight, I had trouble with printing our tickets in the public PC of the hotel. Although, it was obviously the time to change shifts, both Marc and Isabel stayed with me, offered me the front -desk computer(!!!) and started a discussion while I was trying to fix the tickets problem. The most amazing of all? They even offered to compensate me because the public PC was not printing out!!!! We had a great time in Barcelona and part of it was because of these two young perople and their kindness. After travelling for quite a few years, this is the first time, I leave a city remembering the names and faces of people I met in a hotel . We would definately recommend the hotel and will stay there again next time we are in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “silken change my vision regarding three stars hotels”
Reviews.Author: bley64
Reviews.Content: I just return from a 3 night stay with my wife and I can not find enything bad about this hotel of three stars. In fact I can say that is the best three stars hotel that I ever sleep in my turist life!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and tranquile but a little bit off”
Reviews.Author: Shiput99
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in St. Gervasi for 113 Euros/night breakfast and parking included. Apart from the afield location the room was very spacious and clean. The breakfast buffet included everything as expected on an international breakfast buffet. The staff was very friendly and helpful except of an female receptionist, who couldn´t tell us where to buy international newspaper.

Reviews.Title: “You Can Find Better”
Reviews.Author: CoolBreeze2010
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great staff, decent restaurant, cheap rates. Cons: What is going on with the entry way? There was a chopped up grey carpet lying across the floor throughout the time I stayed in this hotel that you had to watch out for every time you entered the building. The whole lobby looked dirty. Location - close to a metro station, but not one that is run by the same company that operates those inside the city - a little inconvenient. Also, no taxi stand? Walking to the main street and hoping to catch someone passing by isn't what I like to do when I'm on the way to a meeting. The consierge was helpful in calling cabs when they could, but with wait times up to 20 minutes during rush hour - I had to risk the walk down to the main street almost everytime. Sleep Quality - I had to ask to be moved to another room after one night here. I was placed in the first room on the bottom floor, close to the kitchen and consierge. From about 5AM onward all I could hear was the banging of pots and pans and the consierge's heels clicking back and forth past my door. My next room was one facing the street, so the pots/pans/heels were replaced with motorcycles and beeping horns. This place may want to consider some renovations to make the rooms a bit more soundproof. Free Internet, but it is so slow I ended up having to go to a Starbucks to work everyday. I don't know how this hotel has gotten such a high ranking on TripAdvisor - I've stayed in much better hotels who are ranked lower. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “logical place to stay if you like to use the subway”
Reviews.Author: tenskibik
Reviews.Content: Rather than spend our nights crammed into a cheap hotel closer to the rambla and the different quarters, we opted to stay 4 nights at St Gervasi. It is well worth it if you are capable of using the subway system (which is easy to figure out). Rooms were very clean, staff was courteous, and they had free wi-fi. The restos in the area are not great- but if you are spending a couple of nights exploring you will find TONS of good food all over the city. Overall would not have done it differently.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: cocoparislondon
Reviews.Content: I went on holiday with 3 of my friend and I don't regret my stay in this hotel. The reception was speaking english but not french ashamed for my friend, lol. She was very helpful. We didn't book at the same ticket but she managed to give us room next to another that was great. The hotel was very calm. The room and hotel were clean daily. I fully recommended this hotel good price, good location with tube not far, and clean at all time.

Reviews.Title: “Average; reasonable rates, but too far off, and some rooms noisy”
Reviews.Author: YenZotto
Reviews.Content: We (2 couples on a touristic trip to Barcelona) stayed at the Silken St. Gervasi for three nights in June 2009. It was average in almost all respects. The rooms were clean, well equipped, functional, but nondescript - you could find the same room in any European 3-star from Dublin to Sofia. Slightly annoying: when we arrived early afternoon, the rooms were not yet ready (although this had been specified before). Each room had a safe in the wardrobe, but they were not fixed with bolts and could have been easily removed as a whole. The hotel is located on a narrow but noisy street. One of the rooms had its windows to the street, and with an open window we were woken up at around 5 by the traffic. The other room was very calm - sleeping with the window open was not a problem. Staff were reasonably professional and the receptionists spoke good English and French, but when one of us had lost some documents on the way from the airport, they didn't know any lost+found telephone numbers. We had found some numbers in our own travel guide book, and the receptionists were kind enough to call them up for us. Breakfast: no need to take it at the hotel - there are a few nice places for continental breakfast in the vicinity of the hotel, especially around Plaça de Joaquim Folguera. Getting there: the hotel is a bit off the main attractions of the city. The nearest subway station ("El Putxet", line 7) is within easy walking distance (2 or 3 minutes). But the big problem is that you always have to change trains at Plaça Catalunya (and often at yet another station) and walk through miles of tunnels there. As mentioned by other reviewers before, subway line 7 is not operated by the same company as the other "metro" lines. Single tickets for the metro are not valid on this line, you need an extra ticket. However, the multi-ride "T10" tickets are valid on all city train lines (including line 7 and the line from and to the airport), *and* they cost much less than 10 single tickets. Changing trains is included in a single ride. You can also use a T10 ticket for multiple persons on a single ride (just need to validate it several times at the gates). Overall recommendation: I would recommend this hotel for a short-term business traveler - decent value for money. But for my next touristic trip to this city I'll choose a different place, not as far from the places of interest in town.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: scooterpie77
Reviews.Content: Positives: Hotel is pretty close to a sub stop as it is a short walk down the street...up some stairs and than another short walk. 5 minute walk at most though if you have problems with steps it might take a bit longer to get around. Hotel was pretty cheap since it is outside the heavy tourist areas and a great value and still a short walk to the transportation to get into town. Negatives: Absolute nightmare to park if you have a car. Tiny protected lot underground that had the tighest turn I've ever seen to get down and we've driven all throughout Europe many times over the years. Took us awhile to get in and out so I'd suggest either not taking a car or parking it than using transportation (which is what I suggest for all big European cities anyway). The parking was pretty expensive as well. In addition, no free breakfast at all and the Internet was really expensive. That all being said, for the price...if you don't mind taking public transport into the city...this is a solid choice for your Barcelona home base.

Reviews.Title: “comfie beds, bad location”
Reviews.Author: Mitikired
Reviews.Content: well i will start off saying that i was returning to barcelona on the tail end of a two week trip of spain. We had stayed at bed and breakfasts, 4 and 5 star hotels in our journey. St. Gervasi offered the most comfortable bed of our trip! I am not saying it is overly plush or anything, but we had been sleeping on what felt like boards so this was a welcome relief. the location is out of the way and the area does not have too much going on. it may seem like it is close on the metro line, but the line 7 is NOT a metro-it is a different style of train so you have to purchase an extra ticket. i say if you are visiting barcelona and you want to also stay in gracia, I recommend this hotel. if you want to stay in Barcelona, check out the bed and breakfast we loved-Casa de billy barcelona (i could not find it on trip advisor though).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Housyar
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Good location, close to metro station El Putxet. The breakfast is good. Nice and clean rooms. I would recommmend this as a low-budget, good quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katrina3003
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a weekend break to watch fc barcelona. Ended up getting a taxi from the airport as didn't have a clue where i was going, cost 23euros so not too bad. Staff were welcoming and friendly. Room was of average size and very clean! Especially liked the little things they gave you i.e toothbrush, comb, tissues etc. Only downfall is no tea or coffee facilities in the room and for 2 coffees was 6euro. But there are a few little cafes close by. Only 2 min walk from the metro and 8 mins into the centre, very good location! Nice neighbourhood also. Booked through rooms.net and paid £150 for 3 nights. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: hnpepe
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. I booked because of the great reviews on tripadvisor. There were barely any negative reviews and they were right. It was great. The front desk spoke perfect English. They overbooked for our class of room so we got bumped to a Junior Suite. It had a great view and a jacuzzi tub. The shower is tiny and so is the elevator. So if you are a large person or claustrophobic this may not be the hotel for you. But other than that, this was a great hotel. Also this hotel is far walking distance from a lot of tourist destinations. We rode the Metro and we liked staying in less tourousty part of town. There is a Silken on Las Rambla but I haven't stayed at that one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: ladyridercymru
Reviews.Content: With this being my first trip to Spain I was filled with trepidation at the expectation of what the hotel was going to be like. I had heard that people had booked hotels online and didn't get what they paid for in Spain. However I was very pleased with this hotel. Firstly it is easily reachable from Ex Puxet Metro just two rights and you are there. Only a five minute walk literally. Ok so its on the north side of Barcelona, and up a quiet side street, but only a short walk to a fabulous quiet park with immense city views (highly recommended) The reception is open and inviting with staff that can speak French and English as well as their Mother tongue on call 24 hours a day! Fantastically polite, and very willing to please, I was made to feel right at home. The room was cosy with a clean bathroom, fresh towels and a fantasitic array of bath freebies.. a picasso box in an array of colours.. truly fab! The bed was comfortable, TV and a mini fridge containing an assortment of refreshments and snacks. I found these to be a bit on the expensive side, but across the road from the hotel is a local Spar grocer store that sells pretty much everything and very cheap. There is a cafe/bar for coffee and more along with a restaurant. Admittedly I did not eat here as I was too busy exploring the city to spend time at the hotel! Overall the hotel was comfortable and friendly. Not to mention helpful with advice when I needed it. There is internet access and to date was €5.25 for a 45 minute card that you could reuse until your allotted time ran out. This was a god send for me as I don't own a laptop. I found the hotel to be excellent value for money, clean and comfortable. Thats what you want during your stay isn't it?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, book with care”
Reviews.Author: AnieM
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, however on arrival was informed our double room was unavailable that night, so we were offered a single that night and a suite the next 2 days- I booked pretty late before visiting so got the impression the hotel took our booking knowing there was no double room available but wanted as many rooms as possible full. Read a number of other reviews also saying this happened to other people. Nice hotel- but be wary if this would be inconvenient to you!

Reviews.Title: “Better deal with easy access to city”
Reviews.Author: picassofishface
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 night stay. Booked at last minute based on reviews & price. Location & Directions: Although this is out of city centre, the advantage is it's quieter, better value & the train station is 2mins away. The maps on the site & Google aren't that accurate, so follow these directions: From airport get the blue aerobus to the terminus at Placa Catalunya (it only costs 7 Euros return & takes about half an hour). At Pl Catalunya, cross to the opposite side of the square (like a big roundabout) & on the corner of the next street look for the sign for FGC station. If you're here for a few days, select the T10 ticket option - this allows 10 journeys on any Metro/FCG Train/Bus in Zone 1 (otherwise just get a single for 1.30 Euros). Take the brown Line 7 to El Putxet Station (5 stops to Pl Catalunya) - takes less than 10mins. When leaving El Putxet, as you come up the steps, bear right & use the exit signposted 'C. Joaquim Folgeura'. At street level, turn right & look for 'Mercat de Sant Gervasi' (an indoor meat/fruit & veg market). Walk down the side of this & across a pedestrianised square to the road that runs parallel to the one you left. The road you are then on is Carrera de St Gervasi de Cassoles (which is the actual address for the hotel). Head left down this road & about 200 yards on the left is the hotel (opposite the SPAR supermarket). There's several cafe's, tapas bars & restaurants nearby (the hotel breakfast was ok for the money, but the evening meal we had was overpriced & they even charged us for the bread rolls!). As it's a residential area, take your phrasebook with you as, unlike in the city, the local restaurants don't have the menus in English. Alternatively, get the train back into the City for lots of choice. Staff on reception speak good English & were very helpful. Room: We had room 5 to the left of reception on the ground floor. Was a little concerned about noise, but it wasn't that bad, apart from the noisy guests above us who thankfully left after 2 nights. This room had the advantage of a small balcony, but only actually got sun for about half an hour. Room 6 next door was better positioned, but as the rooms face into an internal 'courtyard', the surrounding walls tend to block much of the sun. The room was a good size with a decent sized bed, wardrobes & safe deposit box . Decor is contemporary & functional, although TV picture quality was poor. There's a small mini bar with enough room to store some water/soft drinks from the SPAR across the road. No tea/coffee facilities in room (seems to be a common theme in Barcelona!). Bathroom was good size with shower/bath & hairdryer. Good range of complimentary toiletries i.e. tissues/ toothbrush & paste/disposable razor & cream/small bottles of shampoo & bath gel/bath sponge/comb, but only a 2inch square piece of soap! Aircon works, but heating didn't (we had mixed weather, so had to turn off air con to keep room warmer). Out & about: To get back to city take FCG train to Placa Catalunya - you're then at the top end of Las Rambla & can use Metro to most places from there. Alternatively, if you want to visit Park Guell, just turn left out of hotel & when you reach main road, cross over to other side & walk up to the right about 200 yards to get the no: 74 bus - tell the driver where you want to go & they'll happily tell you when you're at the right stop (think it's near Larrard). At the drop off, cross over the dual carriage way & walk down to the left then take the 2nd right up the hill - it's signposted up to Park Guell. To get to the city from there look for the park exit nearest to Valcarca Metro station (near Glories?) - it's about 400 yards downhill to the station & turn right at the main road (again it's signposted all the way).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Canadians-in-UK
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and clean hotel with friendly staff but for the price, we were quite disappointed. When we checked in, the TV didn't work. Who goes to Barcelona to watch TV, you'll say ? True, but for the price, we wanted to sample some Spanish shows. The staff was really nice and offered to change our room, but they put us in a smoking room that stunk (room 107) and it was situated right beside the cleaning ladies' closet so at 6 in the morning, we started hearing doors opening and closing and rampaging around. Plus, that particular room gave onto some kind of alley where for some reason, people (or maybe workers) threw rocks in some kind of metal bin. We didn't sleep for the whole 3 nights we were there. If our reservation hadn't been prepaid, we would have changed hotels. Furthermore, if this had happen right in downtown Barcelona, I could have understood it, but since that hotel is a bit out of the way, the inconveniences were not worth it at all. True, it is really simple to go to Plaza Cataluyana with the metro, but it doesn't change the fact that the hotel is located a bit far out. For us, it wasn't worth it. Gracia is a very nice neighborhood to visit though.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: daisymoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night, booking it on the day itself (at Venere) after we decided to extend our stay in Barcelona. Overall, a fantastic experience! Though the map shows that this hotel is situated quite a distance from the main area (Ramblas, Placa Catalunya), a short 8-minute FGC train ride (no transfers required!) will take you to straight to Placa Catalunya metro station. Even better, the hotel is just round the corner (barely 200m) from the FGC Station (El Puxtet - Line 7). Although rated as a 3-star hotel, the rooms could easily pass off as one belonging to that of a 4-star equivalent. Lobby area is very new, while staff are polite and fluent in English. There's also a convenience store (SPAR Express) right across the road from the hotel entrance. Do note that it's in a quiet area (the hotel seems to cater more for businesss travellers), so don't expect a wealth of F&B outlets (or entertainment for that matter) within the immediate vicinity after business hours.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: LMVEastLondon
Reviews.Content: I took my Boyfriend to Barcelona for his 21st for 3 days and we had a fantastic time! I was quite worried about booking the hotel online incase it didnt meet my expectations but I can honestly say that I have no complaints about the hotel/holiday! The hotel is exactly as you see it in the pictures...the rooms are spacious and clean with a lovely bathroom. We had a MASSIVE bed, safe (no extra cost), mini-bar, TV with satelitte, air conditioning...so there was everything you would possible need! The staff were very friendly, always willing to help and spoke very good english! The hotel is situated in north Barcelona but we didnt find this a problem at all because the metro station is literally a 2 minute walk and only 4 stops away from the centre (aprox 10mins). If you would rather take a taxi then it is aprox 12€ from the hotel to the centre!! There is so much to do in Barcelona and I would highly reccomend this hotel to anyone...me and my boyfriend are already trying to book up to go back again and if we do we would go back to the Silken St Gervasi with no hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and affordable”
Reviews.Author: JBERLOV
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent value for the price you pay. Great location, right next to the subway station. Very large and clean hotel room. You will not find a better value in Barcelona, if you are looking to stay on a budget. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: tam5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. A good safe location. Found the room rather small but clean. Room safe did not work. Walls very thin - could here other guests. Room/hotel info in the room was grubby and had been there a long time. Good bathroom with plenty of nicely presented toileteries. One the whole the staff were good but found the breakfast waiter couldn't be bothered to come and serve us and we were the only two people in the breakfast room! Decent breakfast though. Paid £66 per night per room - this included breakfast.
